title: Test deletion workflow
description:
Test session deletion on iOS stops replication.

Steps:
1. iOS has session subscribed
2. User swipes to delete session
3. iOS sends session_deleted message
4. Verify backend stops sending updates to that iOS client
5. Verify backend .jsonl file still exists
6. Verify other iOS clients still receive updates
7. Create new prompt from terminal in deleted session
8. Verify first iOS client does NOT receive update
9. Verify other clients DO receive update
acceptance_criteria: Deletion stops replication for that client only, backend file remains, other clients unaffected, updates filtered correctly

title: Performance testing
description:
Test performance with 1000+ sessions.

Tests:
1. Index build time with 1000+ .jsonl files
2. Measure session_list send time (should be <2s)
3. Measure per-session load time (should be <200ms)
4. Verify file watching overhead with 10 subscriptions (<5% CPU)
5. Memory usage with 1000 sessions in index (~10MB)
6. Test pagination in iOS (20 sessions/page loads quickly)
7. Test incremental updates (new message appears <1s after terminal prompt)
acceptance_criteria: All performance targets met, system scales to 1000+ sessions, no degradation with active watching, memory usage acceptable

Tests in manual_test/ can invoke Claude CLI (cost money) while regular tests in test/ are free.

title: Session Replication Architecture
description:
Complete implementation of session replication architecture from REPLICATION_ARCHITECTURE.md.

This epic tracks the migration from iOS session UUID mapping to a unified session replication system where all Claude Code sessions (terminal and iOS) sync to iOS devices via filesystem watching and WebSocket broadcasts.

## Architecture Overview
- Backend watches ~/.claude/projects for .jsonl files
- Maintains fast in-memory metadata index
- Broadcasts session_created/session_updated to all iOS clients
- iOS stores sessions in CoreData with lazy loading
- Optimistic UI for instant feedback
- Client-side filtering for deletion/renaming

## Phases
**Phase 1: Backend (COMPLETE)** - voice-code-74 through voice-code-86
- Metadata index system ✓
- Filesystem watcher ✓
- Protocol handlers ✓
- Session naming ✓
- Manual tests ✓

**Phase 2: iOS (IN PROGRESS)** - voice-code-87 through voice-code-96
- CoreData schema
- Session metadata sync
- Lazy loading
- Incremental updates
- Optimistic UI
- Prompt sending
- Deletion/renaming

**Phase 3: Testing** - voice-code-141 through voice-code-101
- Terminal to iOS sync
- iOS to iOS sync
- Session forking
- Deletion workflow
- Performance testing

## References
- REPLICATION_ARCHITECTURE.md
- STANDARDS.md (WebSocket protocol)
acceptance_criteria: All replication tasks complete (74-101), backend fully tested, iOS implementation complete, end-to-end workflows validated, performance targets met

title: Consolidate backend Makefile into root Makefile
description: The project has two Makefiles: root (iOS tests) and backend/ (Clojure tests). Consolidate into single root Makefile with sections for iOS and backend. Use 'cd backend &&' for backend targets. Maintain all existing targets from both files.

title: Connection status not refreshed after saving server settings
description: When configuring server settings for the first time, Test Connection works successfully, but after clicking Save, the app still shows 'disconnected'. The real connection should be refreshed/attempted after saving settings.

title: Backend sends session_updated with 0 messages after filtering warmup
description:
The handle-file-modified function in replication.clj checks if new-messages is non-empty BEFORE filtering sidechain messages. This causes session_updated messages with empty message arrays to be sent to iOS clients when only warmup messages were added.

Bug location: backend/src/voice_code/replication.clj handle-file-modified function

Fix: Move the (when (seq new-messages)) check to AFTER (filter-sidechain-messages new-messages)

title: Backend re-sends all messages instead of just new ones on session creation
description:
When handle-file-created detects a new session, it doesn't initialize the file-positions atom for that session. This causes subsequent handle-file-modified calls to re-parse the entire file from the beginning, re-sending all messages instead of just new ones.

Evidence: Triple reconciliation in logs (lines 86-88 of console.out) shows all messages being reconciled again after new session creation.

Bug location: backend/src/voice_code/replication.clj handle-file-created function

Fix: Initialize file-positions when creating session metadata in handle-file-created

title: Backend includes non-UUID .jsonl files in session list
description:
The extract-session-id-from-path function in replication.clj accepts any .jsonl filename as a valid session ID without validating that it's a UUID. This causes 'Invalid or missing session_id in session data' warnings in iOS when non-UUID .jsonl files exist in Claude projects.

Evidence: Line 8 of console.out shows iOS warning about invalid session_id

Bug location: backend/src/voice_code/replication.clj extract-session-id-from-path function

Fix: Add UUID validation to extract-session-id-from-path and filter out invalid sessions

title: iOS subscribes twice when creating new session
description:
When creating a new session from SessionsView, the app subscribes to the session in two places:
1. SessionsView.swift:125 - when sending the prompt that creates the session
2. ConversationView.swift:151 - when the view appears after navigation

This causes duplicate 'Client subscribing to session' log entries and duplicate optimistic message creation (though messages don't duplicate in UI).

Evidence: Lines 24-27 and 48-49 in console.out show double subscription and double optimistic message creation

Bug locations:
- ios/VoiceCode/Views/SessionsView.swift:125
- ios/VoiceCode/Views/ConversationView.swift:151

Fix: Remove one of the subscribe calls (likely the one in SessionsView since ConversationView should handle subscription)

title: Existing sessions not loading - only new UI sessions populate
description:
When the app starts, existing Claude Code sessions from the filesystem are not appearing in the session list. Only newly created sessions from the iOS UI are showing up.

Expected behavior: On app launch, the backend should send session_list with all existing .jsonl files from ~/.claude/projects, and iOS should display them in the SessionsView.

Actual behavior: Session list appears empty or only shows sessions created after the app was opened.

This blocks the ability to resume existing conversations and makes the app appear to lose history.

Related: This makes voice-code-123 (double subscription) harder to notice, since long-press to open sessions doesn't work if sessions aren't loaded.

title: Session list interaction is not intuitive - tap vs long-press unclear
description:
The SessionsView interaction model is confusing and doesn't follow iOS conventions:

Current behavior:
- Tapping a session highlights it and shows a checkmark
- Nothing material happens after the tap
- Requires long-press to open the session (but this is broken per voice-code-124)
- The checkbox appears to serve no clear function

Expected behavior (choose one approach):

Option A - Single tap opens session:
- Tap a session → immediately navigate to ConversationView
- Remove checkbox UI entirely
- This matches standard iOS list behavior (Settings, Mail, Messages, etc.)

Option B - Checkbox has real function:
- Keep checkbox for multi-select (e.g., bulk delete, bulk operations)
- Add a visible action button or toolbar when sessions are selected
- Require explicit 'Open' button or different gesture to open a single session

Recommendation: Option A is more intuitive. iOS users expect a single tap on a list item to open it. Checkboxes should only appear during explicit 'Edit' or 'Select' modes.

Files involved:
- ios/VoiceCode/Views/SessionsView.swift
- Session list UI implementation

title: Stale session index causes existing sessions not to load messages
description:
The initialize-index! function loads a cached session index from disk without validating it against the filesystem. When the cached index is stale (e.g., from a test run), iOS receives an outdated session list and cannot load messages from existing sessions.

Bug: Backend loaded index with 1 test session from /var/folders/temp, but filesystem had 712 real sessions.
Impact: iOS showed sessions in list but couldn't load their messages (Session not found warnings in backend logs).
Fix: Added validate-index function that checks index count against filesystem and validates sample files exist. Index is rebuilt if validation fails.
Test coverage: Added test-validate-index with 5 test cases covering all validation scenarios.
Tests passing: 70 tests, 371 assertions, 0 failures.

title: Case-sensitive session lookup prevents iOS sessions from loading
description:
iOS sends uppercase UUIDs (e.g., 6F362136-EF8D-48FB-87C4-82AC582A2618) but backend files use lowercase (e.g., 6f362136-ef8d-48fb-87c4-82ac582a2618.jsonl). Session lookups in get-session-metadata, subscribe-to-session!, unsubscribe-from-session!, and is-subscribed? were case-sensitive, causing Session not found errors.

Root cause: iOS generates UUIDs via UUID().uuidString which uses uppercase hex digits. Claude CLI uses lowercase. The session-index map keys are lowercase (from filenames) but lookups did not normalize the input session-id.

Fix: Modified 4 functions in replication.clj to normalize session-id to lowercase using str/lower-case before lookups or set operations.

Test coverage: Added test-case-insensitive-session-operations with 4 test scenarios covering all case combinations.

Bug locations: backend/src/voice_code/replication.clj and backend/test/voice_code/replication_test.clj

Tests passing: 71 tests, 388 assertions, 0 failures.

title: Backend: Index keys are uppercase but lookups use lowercase
description:
Case-sensitivity mismatch in session index. Index is built with uppercase UUID keys from filenames, but get-session-metadata normalizes to lowercase for lookups. This causes sessions with uppercase UUIDs (from iOS) to appear missing even though they exist on disk.

Root cause: build-index! in replication.clj:175-195 uses session-id as-is from filename (uppercase), but get-session-metadata:279-282 normalizes to lowercase.

Fix: Normalize session-id to lowercase in build-index! before using as map key: (assoc acc (str/lower-case session-id) metadata)

Impact: ~11+ sessions with uppercase UUIDs cannot be found via lookup despite being in the index.

title: Remove Tailscale setup from Help (or remove Help entirely)
description: Remove the Tailscale setup information from the Help section. We don't want third-party product names like that in our product. Consider whether the entire Help section should be removed or if it should contain different content.

title: Fix session auto-closing issue (some sessions still affected)
description: Some sessions (not all) are still auto-closing after being opened, despite the previous fix in commit 7f40d7e that made session an @ObservedObject. Previous context: User reported session opening then immediately closing. Logs showed session opens, receives session_history with 0 messages (backend filtered sidechain messages), then onDisappear fires and session unsubscribes. Need to investigate why this still happens for some sessions after the property wrapper fix.

title: Fix 'Sending...' spinner to stop when backend receives message
description: The 'Sending...' spinner currently keeps spinning until Claude Code responds to the user's message. Under our new async architecture, it should stop as soon as the backend receives the message (when we get backend acknowledgment), not wait for the full Claude response. This will provide better user feedback about message delivery status.

title: Add clearable server errors list feature
description: Create a feature to show a list of server errors that can be cleared by the user. Currently transient errors appear below the 'Tap to Speak' button. Consider options: keep current inline error display, or add a button/icon that navigates to a dedicated errors view where users can see error history and clear individual or all errors. This will provide better error visibility and management for users dealing with connection or server issues.

title: Backend: Index keys are uppercase but lookups use lowercase
description:
Case-sensitivity mismatch in session index. Index is built with uppercase UUID keys from filenames, but get-session-metadata normalizes to lowercase for lookups. This causes sessions with uppercase UUIDs (from iOS) to appear missing even though they exist on disk.

Root cause: build-index! in replication.clj:175-195 uses session-id as-is from filename (uppercase), but get-session-metadata:279-282 normalizes to lowercase.

Fix: Normalize session-id to lowercase in build-index! before using as map key: (assoc acc (str/lower-case session-id) metadata)

Impact: ~11+ sessions with uppercase UUIDs cannot be found via lookup despite being in the index.

title: Unknown message type 'session_deleted' in WebSocket handler
description:
Console shows WARNING: Unknown message type {:type session_deleted}

The WebSocket message handler is receiving messages with type 'session_deleted' but has no handler for this message type.

Needs investigation:
1. Is this a valid message type that should be handled?
2. Should it be added to the WebSocket protocol spec in STANDARDS.md?
3. Or is something incorrectly sending this message type?

Current protocol (per STANDARDS.md) defines: connect, prompt, set_directory, ping, message_ack (client→backend) and hello, connected, ack, response, error, pong, replay (backend→client).

'session_deleted' is not in the spec.

title: Auto-speak for active session not working
description:
Auto-speak functionality is not working for the active session - responses never trigger speech output.

Expected behavior: When a session has auto-speak enabled and receives a response from Claude, the response should be automatically spoken.

Actual behavior: Responses are received but never spoken, even when auto-speak is enabled.

Needs investigation:
1. Is the auto-speak flag being properly stored/retrieved from session state?
2. Is the response handler checking the auto-speak flag?
3. Is the speech synthesis being triggered with the response text?
4. Are there any errors in the audio/speech pipeline?
5. Does manual 'speak' work, indicating this is specifically an auto-trigger issue?

title: Session messages showing 'No messages yet' despite having messages
description:
Bug: Sessions displayed '11 messages' on list page but showed 'No messages yet' when opened

Root Cause:
- System messages have different structure: {type: 'system', content: '...'}
- User/Assistant messages: {type: 'user/assistant', message: {content: '...'}}
- iOS extractText() only checked for nested message.content, failing for system messages
- This caused 'Invalid message data, missing role or text' errors (12 occurrences in console)

Fix Applied:
- Updated extractText() in SessionSyncManager.swift:424-466 to handle both formats
- First checks nested message.content (user/assistant)
- Falls back to top-level content (system messages)
- Added 2 new tests: testExtractTextFromSystemMessage, testExtractTextFromSystemMessageWithPlainContent
- All 25 SessionSyncManager tests pass

Files Modified:
- ios/VoiceCode/Managers/SessionSyncManager.swift (extractText function)
- ios/VoiceCodeTests/SessionSyncManagerTests.swift (added 2 tests)

Impact: System messages (like /status commands) now display correctly in conversation view
notes: COMPLETE FIX: Added support for all 3 message formats (user/assistant/system/summary). All 26 tests pass. Summary messages with 'summary' field now display correctly.

title: Hide server sessions with zero or only system messages
description:
Feature: Hide sessions that were created on the server (not in the frontend) if they have zero messages or only contain system messages.

Context:
- Some sessions appear in the list but contain no useful content
- These sessions clutter the UI and provide no value to users
- Only affects server-created sessions (not user-initiated sessions from FE)

Acceptance Criteria:
- Sessions created in frontend are always shown (regardless of content)
- Server sessions with 0 messages are hidden from session list
- Server sessions with only system messages are hidden from session list
- Server sessions with at least one user/assistant/summary message are shown
- Filtering happens in SessionsView after fetching from CoreData

Implementation Notes:
- Add field to CDSession to track if session was created in frontend
- Update SessionsListView to filter out server sessions with no/system-only content
- May need to check message types in CoreData query or computed property
- Consider performance impact of filtering large session lists

Related:
- voice-code-144 (message parsing fixes)
- voice-code-133 (session grouping)

title: Filter summary messages from iOS display
description:
Summary messages (like 401 errors) are being synced to iOS and displayed to users. These are Claude Code internal messages that should be filtered out.

Root cause: SessionSyncManager.handleSessionUpdated processes all message types without filtering.

Fix: Add filtering in handleSessionUpdated to skip messages where type == 'summary'

Impact: Users see confusing error messages that aren't relevant to their conversations.

title: Filter system messages from iOS display
description:
System messages (like local command notifications) are being synced to iOS and displayed to users. These are Claude Code internal messages that should be filtered out.

Root cause: SessionSyncManager.handleSessionUpdated processes all message types without filtering.

Fix: Add filtering in handleSessionUpdated to skip messages where type == 'system'

Impact: Users see internal system notifications that clutter their conversation view.

title: Write tests for message type filtering
description:
Add tests to SessionSyncManagerTests to verify that summary and system messages are filtered out during sync.

Test cases:
1. Verify summary messages are not created in CoreData
2. Verify system messages are not created in CoreData
3. Verify user and assistant messages are still created
4. Verify message count is correct after filtering

title: Delete existing summary/system messages from iOS CoreData
description:
After implementing message filtering, existing summary and system messages are still in the iOS CoreData database and visible to users.

Solution: Add a one-time migration/cleanup that deletes all CDMessage records where role == 'summary' or role == 'system'.

This should run on app launch after the filtering code is deployed.

title: Default to first premium voice on first launch
description:
When the app is installed and launched for the first time, automatically select the first available premium voice instead of defaulting to a basic voice.

Current behavior: App likely defaults to first available voice regardless of quality

Desired behavior:
1. On first launch, check if any premium voices are available
2. If premium voices exist, set the default to the first premium voice
3. If no premium voices, fall back to first available voice
4. Store this selection in AppSettings so it persists

Implementation:
- Add first-launch detection (using UserDefaults flag)
- Query AVSpeechSynthesisVoice.speechVoices() for premium voices
- Filter for premium quality voices
- Set default voice in AppSettings
- Mark first-launch as complete

Benefits: Better out-of-box experience with higher quality voice synthesis

title: Refresh sessions list after server settings update
description:
When server configuration is updated in settings, the sessions list does not refresh automatically. Users must exit and restart the app to see the sessions populate.

Current behavior:
1. User updates server URL/port in settings
2. User saves settings
3. Sessions list remains empty
4. User must force quit and restart app to see sessions

Expected behavior:
1. User updates server URL/port in settings
2. User saves settings
3. App automatically reconnects to new server
4. Sessions list refreshes and populates with sessions from new server

Implementation:
- In SettingsView, after saving server settings, trigger client.reconnect()
- SessionsListView should observe connection state changes
- When connection is established, automatically request sessions list
- Clear any cached sessions from previous server

Related to voice-code-119 (connection status refresh) but specifically about sessions list population.

title: Auto-read uses wrong voice instead of configured voice
description:
Auto-read for new messages was using default system voice instead of the user's configured voice from Settings.

Root cause: SessionSyncManager.handleSessionUpdated:309 called speak(text) without passing the voiceIdentifier parameter.

Fix: 
- Added appSettings parameter to SessionSyncManager
- Updated speak() call to pass settings.selectedVoiceIdentifier
- Wired appSettings through VoiceCodeClient → SessionSyncManager
- Added tests to verify voice configuration path

Files changed:
- SessionSyncManager.swift: Added appSettings parameter, updated speak() call

- VoiceCodeApp.swift: Passed settings when creating VoiceCodeClient
- ReadAloudTests.swift: Added tests for voice selection

title: Centralize voice selection to prevent inconsistency
notes: Centralized voice management in VoiceOutputManager to prevent voice selection inconsistency. VoiceOutputManager now owns AppSettings and provides speak(text) for automatic voice selection and speakWithVoice(text, voiceIdentifier:) for overrides. Removed appSettings from SessionSyncManager and VoiceCodeClient. All call sites now use consistent voice.

title: Set up Tailscale on server and iPhone
Fix tilde expansion in working directory paths
description: The Examples shows ~/code/voice-code but the server fails with 'Cannot run program in directory ~/code/mono: No such file or directory'. Java's ProcessBuilder doesn't expand tildes - need to expand ~ to actual home directory in invoke-claude before passing to shell/sh

title: "Write
Build session metadata index system
description:
Scan .jsonl files on startup to extract metadata and build in-memory index.

- Scan .claude/projects directory recursively for .jsonl files
- Extract metadata: session-id, name, working-dir, created-at, last-modified, message-count, preview
- Build in-memory map: session-id to metadata
- Persist index to .claude/.session-index.edn for fast reload
- Load from persisted index on subsequent startups
acceptance_criteria: Can build index from 100+ .jsonl files, index persists to .edn, subsequent startups load from .edn (<1 second), contains all required metadata fields

title: Implement .jsonl parser
description:
Parse Claude Code .jsonl format to extract messages.

- Parse .jsonl files (one JSON object per line)
- Extract message fields: role, text, timestamp
- Handle incremental parsing (read only new lines since last position)
- Track last-read byte position per file for incremental reads
- Error handling for malformed JSON lines (skip and log)
- Return structured message list
acceptance_criteria: Can parse full .jsonl file into message list, can parse only new lines incrementally (given last position), handles malformed JSON gracefully, returns normalized message structure

title: Add filesystem watcher with debouncing
description:
Watch .claude/projects for file changes using Java NIO WatchService.

- Use Java NIO WatchService to watch directory
- Listen for: ENTRY_CREATE, ENTRY_MODIFY, ENTRY_DELETE events
- Implement debouncing: wait 200ms of quiet before processing
- Implement parse-retry: retry up to 3 times if parse fails (100ms between retries)
- Update metadata index when files change
- Handle partial writes (debouncing prevents reading mid-write)
acceptance_criteria: Detects new .jsonl files (ENTRY_CREATE), detects modifications (ENTRY_MODIFY) with debouncing, handles partial writes without errors (debounce + retry), updates index when files change

title: Implement selective file watching
description:
Track subscribed sessions and only watch their .jsonl files.

- Maintain atom of subscribed session IDs
- When iOS subscribes: add to set, start watching that specific .jsonl file
- When iOS unsubscribes: remove from set, stop watching file
- Always watch parent directory for new file creation (ENTRY_CREATE)
- Only send updates for subscribed sessions
- Limit to ~5-10 watched files per client
acceptance_criteria: Only watches .jsonl files for subscribed sessions, always detects new session creation, unwatches when client unsubscribes, performance: <5% CPU overhead with 10 subscriptions

title: Add session_list message handler
description:
Send session metadata index to iOS on connection.

- On WebSocket connection (after hello), send session_list message
- Include all session metadata from index
- Format: {type: session_list, sessions: [{session_id, name, working_directory, last_modified, message_count, preview}]}
- Performance target: <1 second to send 666 sessions
- Use snake_case for JSON keys (per standards)
acceptance_criteria: Sends complete session list on connection, JSON format matches protocol spec, performance: <1s for 666 sessions over local network, iOS can parse and display immediately

title: Add session_subscribe message handler
description:
Parse .jsonl file on-demand and send full conversation history.

- Handle subscribe message from iOS: {type: subscribe, session_id: "..."}
- Parse requested .jsonl file (lazy load)
- Extract all messages from file
- Send session_history: {type: session_history, session_id: "...", messages: [...]}
- Add session to watched set (start monitoring for changes)
- Track last-read position for incremental updates
acceptance_criteria: Parses .jsonl on subscribe (lazy), sends full message history to iOS, adds to watched sessions set, handles missing files gracefully (error message)

title: Add session_updated message handler
description:
Send incremental updates for watched sessions.

- Triggered by filesystem watcher (after debouncing)
- Parse only new messages (using last-read position)
- Send to subscribed iOS clients: {type: session_updated, session_id: "...", messages: [new messages]}
- Update last-read position after successful parse
- Only send to iOS clients subscribed to this session
acceptance_criteria: Sends only new messages (incremental), triggered by file modification events, updates tracked position after send, only sends to subscribed clients

title: Add session_created message handler
description:
Broadcast new session creation to all iOS clients.

- Triggered by filesystem watcher (ENTRY_CREATE event)
- Extract metadata from new .jsonl file
- Add to metadata index
- Broadcast to all connected iOS clients: {type: session_created, session_id: "...", name: "...", ...}
- iOS will auto-subscribe to new sessions
acceptance_criteria: Detects new .jsonl files immediately, extracts and indexes metadata, broadcasts to all connected clients, iOS receives and can auto-subscribe

title: Add session_deleted message handler
description:
Track iOS client deletions and stop replication.

- Handle session_deleted from iOS: {type: session_deleted, session_id: "..."}
- Track deleted sessions per iOS client (in client state map)
- Unsubscribe from session (stop watching)
- Ignore future updates for this session for this client
- Do NOT delete backend .jsonl file (file remains on dev machine)
acceptance_criteria: Unsubscribes from deleted session, stops sending updates to that iOS client, file remains on backend (not deleted), other clients still receive updates

title: Update prompt handler for new/resume distinction
description:
Support new_session_id vs resume_session_id fields.

- Parse new_session_id field: call claude --session-id <id> "prompt"
- Parse resume_session_id field: call claude --resume <id> "prompt"
- Remove direct response message (responses come via subscription)
- iOS generates UUID for new sessions
- Send only ack, responses come via session_updated

Protocol:
- {type: prompt, new_session_id: "...", text: "..."} → --session-id
- {type: prompt, resume_session_id: "...", text: "..."} → --resume
acceptance_criteria: Handles new_session_id correctly (--session-id), handles resume_session_id correctly (--resume), no direct response message, responses flow through subscription path

title: Remove old session persistence logic
description:
Clean up iOS session UUID mapping and sessions.edn storage.

- Remove sessions.edn file and storage logic
- Remove channel-to-session atom mapping
- Remove iOS session UUID → Claude session ID mapping
- Remove register-channel! and related functions
- Simplify to pure session replication (no session state management)
- Update tests to reflect new architecture
acceptance_criteria: sessions.edn storage removed, iOS session UUID mapping removed, code simplified (session replication only), all tests passing with new architecture

title: Add session naming logic
description:
Generate default names for sessions.

- Terminal sessions: "Terminal: <dir-name> - <timestamp>"
- iOS sessions: "Voice: <dir-name> - <timestamp>"
- Detect forks: "<parent-name> (fork)" or "<parent-name> (compacted)" if <1min
- Extract working directory from .jsonl or parent folder
- Format timestamp: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM
- Include name in session metadata

Logic:
- If session created <1min after parent: "(compacted)"
- Otherwise: "(fork)"
- Determine Terminal vs Voice by checking if iOS client initiated
acceptance_criteria: Generates meaningful default names, detects and labels forks appropriately, includes working directory and timestamp, names appear in session_list and session_created

title: Write tests for replication system
description:
Comprehensive test coverage for new replication architecture.

Tests:
- Index building from 100+ .jsonl files
- Incremental file parsing (new lines only)
- Debouncing and parse-retry logic
- Selective file watching (subscribe/unsubscribe)
- Protocol messages: session_list, session_subscribe, session_history, session_updated, session_created
- New vs resume prompt handling (--session-id vs --resume)
- Session naming generation
- Deletion handling
acceptance_criteria: All tests passing, coverage for core replication logic, integration tests for file watching, protocol message tests

title: Design CoreData schema
description:
Design CoreData schema for session and message storage.

Entities:
- Session: id (UUID), backendName (String), localName (String?), workingDir (String), lastModified (Date), messageCount (Int), preview (String), isDeleted (Bool)
- Message: id (UUID), sessionId (UUID), role (String), text (String), timestamp (Date), status (MessageStatus enum), serverTimestamp (Date?)

Relationships:
- Session.messages → [Message]
- Message.session → Session

Enums:
- MessageStatus: .sending, .confirmed, .error
acceptance_criteria: CoreData model file created, entities defined with all fields, relationships configured, compiles without errors

title: Implement session metadata sync
description:
Handle session_list message and store metadata in CoreData.

- Receive session_list on WebSocket connection
- Parse sessions array
- Store in CoreData (Session entities)
- Display in sessions list view
- Support pagination (20 sessions per page initially)
- Load more on scroll
acceptance_criteria: Receives session_list, stores all sessions in CoreData, displays in UI with pagination, "load more" works correctly
notes: Updated to clarify handling of session_created broadcasts. This task covers both initial session_list and ongoing session_created messages for terminal sessions.

title: Implement lazy session loading
description:
Load full conversation when user opens a session.

- When user taps session: send subscribe message
- Receive session_history response
- Parse messages array
- Store messages in CoreData (linked to session)
- Display in conversation view
- Show loading indicator during fetch
acceptance_criteria: Sends subscribe on session open, receives and stores session_history, displays messages in conversation view, loading indicator shown

title: Implement incremental message updates
description:
Handle session_updated messages and update CoreData.

- Receive session_updated messages from WebSocket
- Parse new messages array
- Append to CoreData for that session
- Update UI in real-time (if session is open)
- Update session preview and message count in list view
acceptance_criteria: Receives session_updated, appends new messages to CoreData, UI updates in real-time, session list shows updated preview/count

title: Implement optimistic UI for prompts
description:
Display user prompts immediately with optimistic UI pattern.

- When user sends prompt: create Message with status .sending
- Add to CoreData immediately
- Display in conversation view (show sending indicator)
- When session_updated arrives: reconcile by matching text
- Update status to .confirmed, add serverTimestamp
- Handle case where message not found (backend-originated prompt)
acceptance_criteria: User prompts appear instantly, reconciliation works correctly, status updates from .sending to .confirmed, backend prompts handled gracefully

title: Update prompt sending logic
description:
Use new_session_id vs resume_session_id fields for prompts.

- Generate UUID for new sessions (before sending prompt)
- Send subscribe(uuid) before prompt for new sessions
- Use new_session_id field for new sessions
- Use resume_session_id field for existing sessions
- Remove iOS session UUID from protocol
- Working directory from session or user selection

Message format:
- New: {type: prompt, new_session_id: uuid, text: "...", working_directory: "..."}
- Resume: {type: prompt, resume_session_id: uuid, text: "...", working_directory: "..."}
acceptance_criteria: Generates UUIDs for new sessions, sends subscribe before prompt, uses correct field (new_session_id vs resume_session_id), iOS session UUID removed
notes: This task includes auto-subscribe logic for new sessions. When creating a new session, iOS generates UUID and sends subscribe BEFORE sending the prompt, ensuring it receives all updates including the initial response.

title: Implement smart speaking logic
description:
Only speak messages for active/open session.

- Track currently active session ID
- When session_updated arrives: check if message is for active session
- If active session + assistant message: speak it
- If background session: buffer message, update badge count
- Show unread count in session list
- Mark as read when user opens session
acceptance_criteria: Only speaks messages for active session, background sessions show badge count, unread count visible in list, mark as read works

title: Add long-press "Read Aloud" menu
description:
Add context menu to read historical messages aloud.

- Long-press on any message: show context menu
- Menu option: "Read Aloud"
- Trigger TTS for that message text
- Interrupt current playback if needed
- Works for both user and assistant messages
acceptance_criteria: Long-press shows context menu, "Read Aloud" option present, TTS plays selected message, interrupts current playback

title: Implement session deletion
description:
Allow users to delete sessions locally.

- Swipe to delete gesture in session list
- Send session_deleted message to backend
- Mark session as deleted in CoreData (isDeleted = true)
- Hide from UI (filter out deleted sessions)
- Send unsubscribe message
- No backend file deletion (local only)
acceptance_criteria: Swipe to delete works, sends session_deleted to backend, marks as deleted in CoreData, hidden from UI, unsubscribe sent

title: Add session renaming
description:
Allow users to rename sessions locally.

- Edit button or gesture in session detail view
- Text field to enter custom name
- Store in localName field (CoreData)
- Display: localName ?? backendName
- No backend sync (local only)
- Update UI immediately on change
acceptance_criteria: Can edit session name, stores in localName field, displays custom name if set, falls back to backendName, no backend sync

acceptance_criteria: iOS sessions create backend files, sync via file watching works, other iOS clients receive sessions, full history available

title: Test session forking

Test concurrent resume creates fork that appears on iOS.

Steps:

2. iOS subscribes to session
3. From terminal: resume same session (concurrent)
4. Claude creates fork (session-id-fork-1.jsonl)
5. Verify filesystem watcher detects new fork file
6. Verify iOS receives session_created for fork
7. Verify iOS auto-subscribes to fork
8. Verify fork name includes "(fork)" or "(compacted)"
acceptance_criteria: Concurrent resume creates fork, fork detected by watcher, iOS receives session_created, auto-subscription works, fork naming correct
